name: potassium mining and benefication | potassium chloride | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23712/documentation

The dataset describes the production of potassium chloride (KCl). KCl has a K2O content of 60% in terms of mass. The production process combines mining of potash salt and its further beneficiation. The original dataset is documented in Nemecek T. & Kägi T. (2007).;Reference: Nemecek T. & Kägi T. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Swiss and European Agricultural Production Systems. Final report ecoinvent V2.0 No. 15a. Agroscope Reckenholz-Taenikon Research Station ART, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Zurich and Dübendorf, CH, retrieved from: www.ecoinvent.ch.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:; - potassium chloride production, CA-SK, 2000 - 2000 (e16f6afb-c70c-4223-969c-19f9ee34523f)]

Potassium chloride production process starting from underground mining of potash salts.  

This activity ends with dried potassium chloride at factory gate. 
the dataset includes the mining of potash salts, the processes of concentration of the potassium chloride, conditioning and drying. The use of the resource sylvinite was accounted for as well as the disposal of the salt residues on heaps and to rivers. Treatment of other wastes was included. Infrastructure was included by means of a proxy module.
Coating and packaging of the final fertiliser products were not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2012:Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Parent data come from an environmental report for the year 2000.;Data on energy demand come from an energy benchmarking of canadian potash production facilities for the years 2000 and 2001.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Child dataset created as proxy for potassium chloride used in the Quebec context. Data quality indicators have been adjusted accordingly.;The data from parent dataset refer to Germany.;Data for energy demand refer to average data from 11 production facilities in Canada, where 10 are in Saskatechewan and 1 in New Brunswick. As the production volume of the New Brunswick facility is negligible, data are supposed to reflect Saskatchewan situation.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The potash salts stem from underground mines. Conventional underground mining with underground equipment and personnel is considered in this dataset. Solution mining is another technology used in Saskatchewan for the production of potassium chloride but this technology is not covered by this data. The share of total KCl production capacity in Saskatchewan with solution mining was 16% in 2000. Solution mining is a more energy intensive technology than conventional mining (Natural Resources Canada, 2004).;;In the parent dataset, three different technologies are used to concentrate the salt: thermal leaching (solution in hot water), flotation and electrostatic separation. Except for energy demand, the inventory describes a mixture of these processes. ;In Saskatchewan potash industry, most of the mines use a flotation process and only one a thermal leaching process. The energy demand  reflects this situation. ;References : ;Natural Resources Canada (2004). Energy Benchmarking : Canadian Potash Production Facilities. Report for the Canadian Industry Program for Energy Conservation, 21p.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription:
Dataset based on GLO parent dataset. Other data than energy demand are kept from parent dataset (GLO, based on RER data) and may not be representative of the geography and the technology. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
Data for energy demand refer to average data from 11 production facilities in Canada, where 10 are in Saskatechewan and 1 in New Brunswick. As the production volume of the New Brunswick facility is negligible, data are supposed to reflect Saskatchewan situation.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The parent data are based on an environmental report of Kali & Salz (2001). They were supplemented by literature data.

flow.name: potassium chloride
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2012:Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds

exchanges.description: The exchange has been scaled to represent the production of potassium chloride instead of a pure form of K2O. The exchange has been divided with the scaling key of circa 1.58 kg of potassium chloride per kg of K2O. Original amount of the exchange was: 0.0125 kg.

flow.name: Sulfur
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/surface water

exchanges.description:
The exchange has been scaled to represent the production of potassium chloride instead of a pure form of K2O. The exchange has been divided with the scaling key of circa 1.58 kg of potassium chloride per kg of K2O. Original amount of the exchange was: 0.0403 MJ.
Original comment: Estimation. Energy demand by other type than natural gas and electricity represents 3% of total energy consumption (Natural Resources Canada, 2004). This energy has been asumed to be consumed in the form of diesel.

exchanges.description:

Original comment: Literature value. All the heat is supposed to come from district or industrial furnaces or boilers. 
Heat from natural gas is used for mine air heating, building heating, steam generation and product drying (Natural Resources Canada, 2004).
